intro: Leichhardtia kebarensis, commonly known as the Khabar Valley daisy, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of northern Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit with narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring, adding a vibrant touch to the landscape. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry conditions, with deep root systems that allow it to access water from deeper soil layers. Leichhardtia kebarensis is often found in sandy soils and is an important component of the local flora in its native habitat.
